Magmas
This chapter deals with domains (see ) that are closed under multiplication *. Following , we call them magmas in &GAP;. Together with the domains closed under addition + (see ), they are the basic algebraic structures; every semigroup, monoid (see ), group (see ), ring (see ), or field (see ) is a magma. In the cases of a magma-with-one or magma-with-inverses, additional multiplicative structure is present, see . For functions to create free magmas, see .
